data.title: Visit our News Blog for the latest news and events for Big Hanna composter
data.meta_description: Visit our News Blog and learn about the events and exhibitions that Big Hanna are going to attend. Also read about How to fix depleted soils, How to compost and get good soil, How to use compost from food waste as fertilizer, How to fix your food waste problem, How to grow organic food from food waste, Community composting, How does community composting work, Food waste minimization, Easy to compost food waste, Composting made easy with Big Hanna, Our different installation sites all over the world with our unique food waste composter. How to treat the organic waste / fraction, How to treat organic waste from municipal collection, Mechanical equipment for composting. Read all this in our News Blog for Big Hanna composter, online since 2010 covering many subject within composting and especially food waste from restaurants, prisons, schools, housing areas, high security sites and municipal collection. Find out why you should compost your food waste, food scraps, kitchen waste on site instead of sending it away to landfill. Save money, save the planet – it has never been easier. Read the Big Hanna News Blog! The Big Hanna News Blog have success stories of installations all over Europe, in Sweden, Norway, Finland, England, Scotland, Wales, Northern Ireland, Ireland, Italy, Greece, Spain and Big Hanna’s are also installed in Uganda, Djibouti, New Zealand, China, Bangladesh, India, Costa Rica and many more countries all over the world.
data.text:
Spanish hotel – ‘closes the circle’ with composting

In 2020 a Big Hanna composter T120 was installed at hotel Cala Jóncols www.calajoncols.com, in the Natural park of Cab de Creuz located in the northwestern part of Spain. A small hotel in an idyllic place with a focus on sustainability. Read more about the...

read more

Happy Holidays!

A fantastic film about soil, CO2 and how healthy soils can improve our climate

We would like to recommend the amazing film "Kiss the ground" about healthy soils, how it is possible to restore depleted soil and at the same time how healthy soils can absorb CO2 from our atmosphere. This film convinced us that only reducing our emissions alone will...

read more

5th of December – The World Soil Day

Today the 5th of December UN has announced as the 'World soil day' 2020. It is announced by FAO - 'Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations'. 'A healthy soil gives among many other things healthy and nutritious food to eat and a high-quality compost is...

read more

Restaurant El Raso in mountain area of Madrid

The 'Restaurant El Raso', located in Collado Villalba in the mountain area of Madrid, Spain, is the first restaurant composting their food waste by themselves with a Big Hanna composter in this area. This Big Hanna processes about 35-40 kilo food waste per day,...

read more

Hotel is composting their food waste with Big Hanna since 2006

For 14 years our Big Hanna composter has been installed at Kelly's Resort Hotel & Spa in Co Wexford in Ireland. This Big Hanna composter model T480 has an infeed system that automatically macerates and dewaters the food waste before it is fed into the composter....

read more

13 years of composting at Vitsippan – a home for the elderly

In 2007 Vitsippan, a home for the elderly, was built in Gislaved, a town in southern part of Sweden. This Big Hanna composter model T60 was installed and have been composting the food waste from the kitchen ever since, 13 years of operation. In this home there are 70...

read more

Akron Zoo’s film about how they use their composter

The Big Hanna composter has for a couple of years been installed at the Akron Zoo in Ohio, United States of America. Akron Zoo has published a film about how they use their Big Hanna composter. See the film in this link. You find information about Akron Zoo on...

Big Hanna composter – reclaim responsibility

We believe that people want to take back responsibility and fight climate change locally and are willing to do so wherever they live, work or enjoy life. See how easy it is to compost food waste locally in this video. www.bighanna.com

Sustainable tourism in Tenerife

Today we want to share our customer 'Hotel & Suites Tigaiga's information about how they work towards Sustainable Tourism and renewed their ISO14000 certificate. We are proud that our Big Hanna machine is a part of this. Read more about how they work with...

Big Hanna composter – working in harmony with nature

We believe in nature's own composting process without accelerators nor additives producing a mature compost. We believe that eating 'slow food' is healthier for our bodies and composting leftovers slowly is healthier for Mother Nature. Our natural process gives you...

Composting source separated food waste for small municipalities, restaurants and housing areas

Small scale composting solutions makes it possible to compost it nearby without transporting the food waste long distances to large composting plants. Our Big Hanna composters are used in many countries and in different setups. The flexibility of Big Hanna composter's...

24 years of composting food waste from 26 flats

For 24 years the residents in a housing area in a small fishing village on the Swedish west coast called Grebbestad, have composted their food waste with a Big Hanna composter. This Big Hanna was installed in 1994 and is the first generation of our model T40. In this...

The benefits of using compost – factsheets from European Compost Network

'In organic farming, the earth is seen as a living organism. You could say that the earth breathes, eats, grows and rests' Translation from Anna Backlin's book 'Jord i god kultur 2005'ECN (European Compost Network) have published two factsheets about compost and the...

Big Hanna composter – circular economy

Compost your food waste on site, circular economy since 1991. We believe that decentralized solutions are the best way to make our world sustainable. Our flexible small-scale systems allow you to control the input and by that the quality of the compost. See how easy...

Akron Zoo got the POOwer!

Happy Earth Day! Let’s talk about poop!

Our animals poop a lot. Our staff here at the Akron Zoo have found a way to use the poop to help benefit our environment – composting! Two years ago we debuted a state-of-the-art aerobic composter called Big Hanna. Big Hanna “eats” the animal poop and other items like food scraps and after a few weeks, creates compost that our horticulture team can use in our beautiful gardens.

read more

Big Hanna, Covid-19 information

Susteco AB and our main suppliers are open but are of course taking the recommended precautions in order not to spread Covid-19. We are available if you have any questions regarding composting, spare parts or machines. We realize that some of our customers will have...

Composting at MEF Schools, Istanbul, Turkey

We are pleased to announce that on 5 February 2020, a Big Hanna Composter model T120 with a biofilter was installed at MEF Schools for turning kitchen waste into fertilizer. MEF Schools is a well-known private national school located in the Ortaköy district of...

Big Hanna composter, working in harmony with nature

Big Hanna does not use any accelerators nor additives when it is producing mature compost. We believe in working in harmony with nature.

We are adding new tools to Big Hanna’s toolbox

In addition to temperature sensors throughout the biological process it is now possible to monitor moisture in the mass inside the cylinder and humidity + CO2 in the air from the Big Hanna composter.

First in Portugal to compost their food waste with Big Hanna – Restaurante Mauritânia Real

Earlier this month Fenix Ambiente in co-operation with Berca Brand installed a Big Hanna at the famous Restaurante Mauritânia Real in Matosinhos, Portugal. Our representative, Fenix Ambiente is dedicated to solutions focused on local, community and municipal composting and works to help their customers meeting the European goals and establishing a circular economy where the natural compost will be used to recover depleted soils.

Big Hanna’s RFID tags – a system making it easy to reward those who are doing it right

We believe in giving back the power to choose a system to where the system is going to be implemented. We believe that decentralized solutions are the best way to make our world sustainable. Our flexible small-scale systems allow you to control the input and by that the quality of the compost.
